Posts.Content: Hey Beppie.....I had invasive ductal ....found out with regular mammogram. I was less than 2 cm. and stage 2. I had the lumpectomy....didn't stay over night and was driving the next day....wasn't surpose to...but I am single and hate to ask people to do things for me. I did 33 days of radiation and I will tell you, you will get tired.I did teach during that time. I am on Femara and it does make me tired and achy, but I feel blessed that it was caught when it was....it could be worse. You will find that BC survivors are strong and supportive people...I have a friend who is a 20 year survivor. I found everyone that were involved...drs. rad. nurses were absolutely wonderful. They will do a sentinel node test during surgery to see if the lymph nodes are involved. It's a dye and travels to the first 2 lymph node and they will test those. It sounds like it was caught early and probably none are involved. KD just had a lumpectomy and she'll be on the board. It's normal to be upset, but it could always be worse! Come back to vent, if you need to...we have all been there.
Posts.Title: Ductile Carcinoma 1 2 3

Posts.Content: Hey Beth. I posted a reply yesterday, but who knows what happened to it! I did have a lumpectomy and did not spend the night at the hospital....sort of like a drive thur! I drove the next day...wasn't surpose to, but had a couple of things to do. I took 33 days of radiation....I will tell you....it makes you tired, but I taught while I was taking it....the process you are talking about I don't know about, but have heard of it. When I was told I had BC, I was so brave.....I suprised myself!! My mom had it when she was 81 and went through it , so she was my inspiration. It was only after all the treatments that it really hit me.....I found it was like the stages of grief. The realization hit me. We have Cancer Services and they offered a program called Survive and Thrieve and it was just what I needed. I met some wonderful people and my eyes were opened at how some young people at age 16 faced and fought the beast. As for Femara, I don't know the time limit. I have only been on it a year. I know it is 5 yrs most people stay on it. Did they say when you will have surgery? I know you don't think so right now, but you are very fortunate that they found it so early. Along the journey, you will meet some extraordinary survivors...they will give you inspiration and strength...as will we.
Posts.Title: Ductile Carcinoma 1 2 3

Posts.Content: I had a lump. and was told not to have blood pressure or blood drawn from that arm. Other things were...not to carry your pocketbook on that shoulder, try not to do competitive motion for over 30 mins., don't carry real heavy objects with that arm, watch pulling and pushing with the arm.
Posts.Title: Ductile Carcinoma 1 2 3

Posts.Content: kd, Bless you...you have been through so much. I will keep you in my prayers and thoughts. I will be leaving Wed. to be with my 83 year old aunt who is having a mast. Thurs. While having her breast mri, she broke 2 ribs, but insist on carrying on with the surgery. Will be back on next week. Positive thoughts coming your way.
Posts.Title: well, now have to have mastectomy; lumpectomy not enough.

Posts.Content: Good morning! I take Femara...no dizziness...thank heavens. It makes me so sleepy and sometimes, when I do too much, my bones ache. I started with Arimidex, but it made me crazy....I was a nervous wreck. Being dizzy is no fun at all,,,I have been there. Call your dr. I have found that all mine are wonderful.
Posts.Title: Femara and dizziness 1 2

Posts.Content: KC, Sorry you received bad news about bc, but I had a lumpectomy last April and I did just fine. I had 33 days of radiation and I will tell you, it makes you pretty tired. I was able to carry on everyday, but had to rest. I had the sentinel nodes tested and they were clean. I take Femara since my was hormonal. I am 61 and have no children...have a sister but she had back surgery about 2 weeks after mine. Your friends and neighbors will be there for you.....the breast cancer community is very close. Stay strong and keep on posting as we are your sisters.
Posts.Title: Mammogram/ultrasound/ What Next ?

Posts.Content: It doesn't take a very long to do the biospy and and I was so stressed out that I got the preliminary the next day. Good luck! Stay positive!
Posts.Title: Breast Biopsy.........

Posts.Content: I went for my 1 year mam. I was so nervous because it was my first mam. on the breast that did not have cancer. The radiologist read it then. When I was first diagnosed, the rad. did not tell me....my dr. called me with the news. I would imagine that they would prefer not give the results. Call your dr. Thurs. and ask him/her. I once went by the breast clinic and got the report, because my dr. was out of town. Good luck
Posts.Title: can radiologist give results?
